body:
We have a build system which generates build.gradle files outside our source directory, because we want our source tree to be free of any build and output related files. Therefore, our build system will create symlinks to source directories in our source tree and sets the `sourceSets.main.java.srcDirs` property to point to the symLink.

Our build system also generates some java files of its own and writes them in a directory which is a sibling of the symlink. Our directory layout is like this:

```
src/main/java/
              build/
                   com/
                       foo/bar/x 
             linkparent/
                      com/          // <- This is a symlink to a source directory outside of the project
                          foo/bar/y
```

In the build.gradle file, we have:
```
	sourceSets {
		main {
			java {
				srcDirs = ['src/main/java/build', 'src/main/java/linkparent']
			}
		}
	}
```

What we are seeing is odd. If we clean and build, we get successful builds. However, if we modify a file under the symlink and do a build, we get the following error:

> Execution failed for task ':app:compileDebugJavaWithJavac'.
> Unable to find source java class: '/Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/src/main/java/src-source/com/example/as34app/MainJavaClass.java' because it does not belong to any of the source dirs: '[/Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/src/main/java/build, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/src/main/java/src-source, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/src/debug/java, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/build/generated/not_namespaced_r_class_sources/debug/processDebugResources/r, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/build/generated/source/buildConfig/debug, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/build/generated/aidl_source_output_dir/debug/compileDebugAidl/out, /Users/dario/Dev/Builds/AS34App/app/build/generated/renderscript_source_output_dir/debug/compileDebugRenderscript/out]'

That output is from a very simple test project I set up, not using our build system. Just a simple project with the same directory structure.

If I clean and build, I once again get a successful build. But again, modifying any file under the symlinked directory means I need to clean and build, which makes for very long development cycles.

### Expected Behavior
Symlinked source directories should behave just like regular source directories

### Current Behavior
Symlinked sourece directories cause build failures when source files under those symlinked directories are modified

### Context
Just trying to edit java source files and build.

### Steps to Reproduce 
See attached project.
* Navigate to project and do `./gradlew build`
* Modify the MainJavaClass.java file under the symlinked source directory
* Do `./gradlew build`
* You should see error similar to above
* Do `./gradlew clean` and then `./gradlew build`
* You should see a successful build
* Repeat by modifying MainJavaClass.java

I was unable to reproduce this with Kotlin files, only Java files

### Your Environment
* macOS: 10.14.4 (18E226)
* Gradle 5.1.1
* Android Studio 3.4, though this issue seems unrelated to Android Studio and has been around since Android Studio 3.0 upgraded gradle to 3.x
* Build scan URL: https://gradle.com/s/goyouqnnog7cq
[AS34App.zip](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/files/3110115/AS34App.zip)
title: "Unable to find source java class" error when file modified sits within symlinked source directory
